ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Run flexible mediation analyses using natural effect models as described in Lange, Vansteelandt and Bekaert (2012) <DOI:10.1093/aje/kwr525>, Vansteelandt, Bekaert and Lange (2012) <DOI:10.1515/2161-962X.1014> and Loeys, Moerkerke, De Smet, Buysse, Steen and Vansteelandt (2013) <DOI:10.1080/00273171.2013.832132>.

Run flexible mediation analyses using natural effect models as described in Lange, Vansteelandt and Bekaert (2012) <DOI:10.1093/aje/kwr525>, Vansteelandt, Bekaert and Lange (2012) <DOI:10.1515/2161-962X.1014> and Loeys, Moerkerke, De Smet, Buysse, Steen and Vansteelandt (2013) <DOI:10.1080/00273171.2013.832132>.

name: r-medflex
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.6-11" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-medflex
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/medflex_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/medflex/medflex_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: b6a1c6ae0794c4259bcd60291d45fac37a18e50115f987554242049fa58dc71f

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix >=1.1_4
    - r-boot >=1.3_8
    - r-car >=2.0_21
    - r-multcomp >=1.3_6
    - r-sandwich >=2.3_2
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix >=1.1_4
    - r-boot >=1.3_8
    - r-car >=2.0_21
    - r-multcomp >=1.3_6
    - r-sandwich >=2.3_2

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('medflex')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('medflex')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/jmpsteen/medflex
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: Run flexible mediation analyses using natural effect models as described in Lange, Vansteelandt and Bekaert (2012) <DOI:10.1093/aje/kwr525>, Vansteelandt, Bekaert and Lange (2012) <DOI:10.1515/2161-962X.1014> and Loeys, Moerkerke, De Smet, Buysse, Steen and Vansteelandt (2013) <DOI:10.1080/00273171.2013.832132>.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - vitodelgrec
